snippet: Phil Hughes, a pitcher the Yankees refused to give up for Johan Santana, has been an All-Star, but he has never strung together more than four quality starts in a row.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column observes that New York Yankees pitcher Phil Hughes, who the Yankees refused to give up for Johan Santana, has been an All-Star but has never strung together more than four quality starts in a row.
lead_paragraph: Phil Hughes, a pitcher the Yankees refused to give up for Johan Santana, has been an All-Star, but he has never strung together more than four quality starts in a row.

headline.seo: Hughes Keeps Trying to Justify Yankees’ Faith
headline.main: Untraded Yankee Keeps Trying to Justify Team’s Faith
headline.print_headline: Hughes, the Untraded Yankee, Keeps Trying to Justify the Faith
